intro: Ferula transitoria, commonly known as the transitory ferula, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its tall, branched stems and yellowish-green flowers. The plant produces a milky sap that contains various volatile compounds, contributing to its medicinal and aromatic properties. Ferula transitoria is often found in rocky and arid environments, thriving in well-drained soils. Its ecological role includes providing nectar for pollinators and serving as a habitat for small invertebrates.
